channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Massacres in eastern Congo cast doubt on U.S. mediated peace deal
item.description: Rwanda backed M23 rebels in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo killed hundreds of villagers in July, according to Human Rights Watch, raising doubts about Trump backed peace process.
item.content:encoded:
Rwanda backed M23 rebels in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo killed hundreds of villagers in July, according to Human Rights Watch, raising doubts about Trump backed peace process.

(Image credit: JOSPIN MWISHA)
item.dc:creator: Emmet Livingstone

item.title: One civilian injured in crash with D.C. National Guard military vehicle
item.description: The military vehicle, which is designed to withstand explosive attacks, collided with a "civilian vehicle" just after 6 a.m. on Wednesday in the Capitol Hill neighborhood of Washington, D.C.
item.content:encoded:
The military vehicle, which is designed to withstand explosive attacks, collided with a "civilian vehicle" just after 6 a.m. on Wednesday in the Capitol Hill neighborhood of Washington, D.C.

(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: Trump vows to expand his review of U.S. museums. Can he do that?Â
item.description: The White House said that after the administration eliminates "woke" culture from the Smithsonian, it would expand to other museums around the country. Would that be possible?
item.content:encoded:
The White House said that after the administration eliminates "woke" culture from the Smithsonian, it would expand to other museums around the country. Would that be possible?

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Anastasia Tsioulcas

item.title: Health innovations play a role in improving living standards and the economy
item.description: Health innovations are everywhere. From a cancer vaccine to an Alzheimer's blood test to a life-changing exoskeleton, we take you on a tour of the economics of health technology.
item.content:encoded: Health innovations are everywhere. From a cancer vaccine to an Alzheimer's blood test to a life-changing exoskeleton, we take you on a tour of the economics of health technology.
item.dc:creator: Wailin Wong

item.title: Dependent on foreign sales, U.S. wheat farmers hoping longtime partners stick with them
item.description: As President Trump's tariffs kick in, American companies that rely on imports are worried about rising costs and passing them onto consumers. But some U.S. exporters are worried too.
item.content:encoded:
As President Trump's tariffs kick in, American companies that rely on imports are worried about rising costs and passing them onto consumers. But some U.S. exporters are worried too.

(Image credit: Kirk Siegler)
item.dc:creator: Kirk Siegler

item.title: Trump calls for resignation of Fed governor in latest line of attack
item.description: President Trump is calling for the resignation of Federal Reserve governor Lisa Cook after a Trump ally accused her of making false statements on mortgage applications.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump is calling for the resignation of Federal Reserve governor Lisa Cook after a Trump ally accused her of making false statements on mortgage applications.

(Image credit: Drew Angerer)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Flooding begins in the Outer Banks as Hurricane Erin moves north
item.description: People in the Outer Banks should shelter in place, authorities said. Meanwhile, life-threatening rip currents are likely at beaches along the East Coast, according to forecasters.
item.content:encoded:
People in the Outer Banks should shelter in place, authorities said. Meanwhile, life-threatening rip currents are likely at beaches along the East Coast, according to forecasters.

(Image credit: Allen G. Breed)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: How Attorney General Pam Bondi has reshaped the Justice Department to suit Trump
item.description: The New Yorker's Ruth Marcus says Bondi has presided over the DOJ's most convulsive transition of power since Watergate, aggressively reversing policies, investigating Trump's foes and firing staff.
item.content:encoded: The New Yorker's Ruth Marcus says Bondi has presided over the DOJ's most convulsive transition of power since Watergate, aggressively reversing policies, investigating Trump's foes and firing staff.
item.dc:creator: Dave Davies

item.title: Some Florida farmers reduce crops as deportation fears drive workers away
item.description: U.S. farmers are feeling the impact of Trump's immigration crackdown.Â In some communities, immigration raids have slowed farm operations.Â NPR reports from Central Florida's strawberry region.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. farmers are feeling the impact of Trump's immigration crackdown.Â In some communities, immigration raids have slowed farm operations.Â NPR reports from Central Florida's strawberry region.

(Image credit: Lexi Parra for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd

item.title: Greetings from the Dubai airport, where a long layover can also be a destination
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.
item.content:encoded: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Bloch
